newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $64, passed - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $64, passed - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains fed cattle bids near midday Monday were light at $64.00 per cwt and passed by owners pricing cattle mostly at $66.00, with a few at $67.00, feedlot sources said.

"The packer is acting like he's willing to take on some extra inventory and has indicated he would pay $65.00 if offered, but so far I haven't heard of anyone willing to sell their cattle at that level," a Kansas feedlot manager said.
Sales last week were mostly at $65.00 in hefty volume, which sold out showlists, including carryover from the previous week. This week's showlists were smaller.
